intro: Opuntia alfagayucca, commonly known as the Mexican prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its flat, fleshy stems, known as cladodes, which are covered in spines and are used for photosynthesis. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers, followed by edible fruits called tunas. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing high adaptability to drought conditions. Opuntia alfagayucca is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in local cultures.
